arts.ttl: Eddie Howe hails 'brilliant' Newcastle star now looking at home on Tyneside
arts.sum: Newcastle are into the Carabao Cup semi-final for the second time in three years and boss Eddie Howe has his eyes on another final after Sando Tonali inspired the Toon to victory over Brentford

arts.ttl: Why Newcastle United opted against famous dressing room tradition after Brentford win
arts.sum: Newcastle United star Dan Burn was asked by Eddie Howe about his famous Carabao Cup dressing room dance after the 3-1 win over Brentford - but politely declined after not getting on the scoresheet. But Newcastle star Burn told Chronicle Live: "The gaffer said: 'What round did you dance in last time?' But I didn't score!

arts.ttl: Newcastle fans stunned by what they saw involving Joelinton against Brentford

arts.ttl: Newcastle boss Eddie Howe delighted with Sandro Tonaliâ€™s two-goal display
arts.sum: The Italian midifelder scored two brilliant first-half efforts to set the Magpies on their way to a second Carabao Cup semi-final in three seasons.

arts.ttl: Eddie Howe makes urgent Newcastle United transfer request after Carabao cup glory
arts.sum: When asked if he could actually afford to lose players, Howe told Chronicle Live: "I think it is a very good question. Reflecting on the win over the Bees, Howe said: "It was a good performance from the players.

arts.ttl: Sandro Tonali gesture shows Newcastle United true colours as fight for Wembley hotels kicks off
arts.sum: Sandro Tonali illuminated St James' Park with a classy midfield display for Newcastle United and brought the goals to keep the Magpies on the road to Wembley! But Brentford were caught napping five minutes later as Tino Livramento attacked down the right with his cross half-cleared by Nathan Collins.
